comments.body: I think this may cause the randomness! `i + self.window_size` could potentially be larger than the entire array leading to accessing random data (or segfaults?)

I changed the test to make sure that it cannot exceed the array size. Let's see what happens :)

I honestly do not know how `BaseIndex` and `rolling` interact but I'm surprised that we get NaNs when not expanding (at least `sum` and `mean` should be able to calculate the sum/mean of one number?)

forget my last comment, NaN is expected since the window size is four: "Minimum number of observations in window required to have a value (otherwise result is NA). For a window that is specified by an offset, min_periods will default to 1. Otherwise, min_periods will default to the size of the window."
